medical_history.chief_complaint: Admission due to a rash, muscle pain, weakness, and respiratory failure.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 10 weeks prior to admission with the development of a violaceous rash. One week later, the patient experienced intense generalized muscle pain and weakness, including difficulty walking, rising from a squat, and climbing stairs. Two weeks later, examination at another hospital revealed significant muscle weakness and various skin manifestations. Prednisone was temporarily beneficial for weakness. Symptoms progressed with further treatment complications.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a meniscal repair 10 years earlier.
medical_history.family_history: Father had hypertension; two aunts had hypothyroidism. No family history of muscle, skin, or other autoimmune disease.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was married, lived with his wife and two young children, and worked in the service industry. He did not smoke or use illicit drugs.
